formData.text$en:
Welcome to the ICT Graduate School Website!  
  
This initiative helps meet the increasing demand for industry-ready ICT graduates.  
  
We offer two programmes, the Postgraduate Certificate of Information Technology (**PGCert**), and the Master of Information Technology (**MInfoTech**).
Invalid Selection. Please try again and use the dropdown!

**Fees and Scholarships for PGCert:**  
  
For information regarding fees and scholarships, including Domestic and International Student costs, visit the site below:
  
[Learn More](https://www.auckland.ac.nz/en/study/study-options/find-a-study-option/postgraduate-certificate-in-information-technology-pgcertinfotech.html#section1)  
  
The ICT Graduate School also offers an award for Maori and Pacific students who wish to study PGCert.  
  
[More details are available here](https://www.auckland.ac.nz/en/study/scholarships-and-awards/find-a-scholarship/auckland-ict-graduate-school-pgcertinfotech-award-1011-sci.html)

**Fees and Scholarships for MInfoTech:**  
  
For information regarding fees and scholarships, including Domestic and International Student costs, visit the site below:
  
[Learn More](https://www.auckland.ac.nz/en/study/study-options/find-a-study-option/master-of-information-technology-minfotech.html#section1)

**Programme Structure for MInfoTech**
  
The MInfoTech offers three options for students from different study backgrounds.  
    
If studying full time, the programme takes between 2-4 Semesters to complete.   
This depends on whether you take the 120, 180 or 240 point study option.   
  
If you're studying part-time, this can vary.  
  
[Learn More](https://www.auckland.ac.nz/en/study/study-options/find-a-study-option/master-of-information-technology-minfotech.html#section1)

**Programme Structure for PGCert**
  
The PGCertInfoTech consists of two 30-point courses in which you'll take practical, hands-on and lab-based courses.  
* [**COMPSCI 718:** Programming for Industry](https://courseoutline.auckland.ac.nz/dco/course/COMPSCI/718/)
* [**COMPSCI 719:** Programming with Web Technologies](https://courseoutline.auckland.ac.nz/dco/course/COMPSCI/719/)  
Full-time and part-time study options are available, including a [part-time online programme](https://www.online.auckland.ac.nz/postgraduate-programmes/science/postgraduate-certificate-in-information-technology/) – ideal for students who would like to work while they study.   
   
If studying full time, the PGCert takes one Semester to complete. Otherwise, it can vary.  
   
[Learn more](https://www.auckland.ac.nz/en/study/study-options/find-a-study-option/postgraduate-certificate-in-information-technology-pgcertinfotech.html#section1)

**Career Opportunities for PGCert**  
  
PGCertInfoTech graduates are employed in roles as diverse as database developers and data security specialists. You can look forward to joining them as you ignite your career in the ICT industry.  

Jobs related to this Programme:
* Communications specialist
* Cybersecurity support
* Business analyst
* Database support
* Internet/multimedia developer
* Network support
* Systems administrator
* Technical consultant

**Career Opportunities for MInfoTech**  
  
As a MInfoTech graduate, you will add value to New Zealand's vibrant, dynamic ICT sector as you acquire advanced, specialist technological skills; gain industry experience in the development and commercialisation of products and services; and understand the demands and expectations of a professional workplace.  
  
Jobs related to this programme:
* Cloud computing specialist
* Cybersecurity specialist
* Data scientist
* Games developer
* Network developer and support
* Software architect
* Software developer
* Team manager

**Prerequisites for PGCert**  
  
Students with a Bachelors degree or equivalent in any discipline are eligible to apply for the Postgraduate Certificate in information Technology.

Applications should be made well in advance of a start in Trimester A (March) or in Trimester C (November).

For enrolment questions, you can email cms@waikato.ac.nz.

**Prerequisites for MInfoTech**  
  
For admission, students will need to have completed a relevant bachelor's degree, normally in Computer Science. You will need an average of at least B in 80 points of 300 level or above including at least 40 points in Computer Science or a related field.

Students with a non-ICT undergraduate degree are encouraged to apply for the Postgraduate Certificate in Information Technology (PGCertInfoTech).
   
**Note:** International students will need to have an IELTS score of at least 6.5 overall (with no less than 6.0 in any band). Email international@waikato.ac.nz for more information or help with the application process.
 
[Learn More About PGCertInfoTech](https://www.waikato.ac.nz/study/qualifications/postgraduate-certificate-in-information-technology)

**Internships for MInfoTech**  
  
Our industry internships are an integral component of the Master of Information Technology (MInfoTech) programme. They provide a unique opportunity for you to work on a real-world project, facilitated by your employer and supported by the University.
 
The University will arrange the internship, taking into account your background and career interests. If you have a relationship with a company, or you’d like to suggest a particular company we are happy to consider that.
 
[Learn More](https://www.ictgraduateschool.ac.nz/internships/for-students/)

The ICT industry is one of the fastest growing industries in the world. As a result there's a huge demand for industry-ready ICT graduates who have the right mix of technological skills and business awareness.  
  
The ICT Graduate School offers postgraduate study in Information Technology
that aims to develop smart, industry-ready ICT graduates who will meet this
need. 

[Learn More](https://www.ictgraduateschool.ac.nz/)

If you want more help, you can contact the ICT Graduate School directly.   
  
We'll aim to get back to you as soon as possible.  
  
[Contact Us](https://www.ictgraduateschool.ac.nz/contact-us/).
